newsitem.title: USA: Busch to drop ads knocking Samuel Adams beer.
newsitem.headline: Busch to drop ads knocking Samuel Adams beer.

text.p: Giant brewer Anheuser-Busch Cos. Inc. has agreed to stop advertising claims about Samuel Adams beer found to be unsupported, the National Advertising Division (NAD) of the Council of Better Business Bureaus Inc. said Monday.

Boston Beer Co. Inc., brewer of Samuel Adams beers, challenged the truthfulness and accuracy of Anheuser-Busch's advertising that included: "Why does Sam Adams pretend to come from New England when the truth is, it's brewed and bottled by contract breweries all around the country?" and "Time to stop tricking beer drinkers, Jim."

The Council said that, while Samuel Adams is brewed and bottled by contract breweries outside New England, it has asked Anheuser-Busch not to imply that Boston Brewing does not control the brewing of its beers at the contract breweries, or that Samuel Adams is the same quality as the low-priced beers these brewers also make.
Anheuser-Busch's advertising agency of record is DDB Needham of Chicago.

"Should we run any future ads, we will take the NAD's comments into account," Francine Katz, vice president-consumer awareness for Anheuser-Busch, said. Katz added that Anheuser-Busch believes the NAD agreed with the company's basic position that advertising should contain accurate information about contract brewing.
